My thoughts after a few hours of using b13.1

Optimizer
=========
Doesn't do what I want it to do.
I'm a feral tank. Among my gear I have T4 Shoulders and Gloves. The T4 Shoulders have a +defence enchant.
When I try to optimize my gear for kitty dps, I can't seem to say that the T4 shoulders have the +defence enchant, and that my other shoulders have the +crit enchant. It's not an option to change enchant on my T4 shoulders, since I'm primarily a tank.
However, I wonder if it's still worth it to use the T4 Shouders with +defence enchant in order to get the set bonus.

Almost same thing with gems. Here I want to select one item to use with the optimizer, but Rawr just wants to select all items with the same id (but with different gems) for optimization. I have some items gemmed with +stamina and +defence gems. I can't change gems on them, but still want to include them as possible items for kitty gear.


Where items come from
=====================
It would be nice to be able to use that information. For example, find upgrades for me from SSC (regardless of slot). Or find upgrades for me from everything except for BT/MH/Sunwell (one slot at a time, as Rawr normally works).


Fill sockets
==========
It would be nice to be able to remove all items with gems, but keep one of each item with empty sockets. I have 11 copies of Thunderheart Cover in Rawr right now...
Then be able to fill (and make copies as follows) (selection which to fill this time):
1) All sockets filled with this gem: select one gem and a meta gem.
2) Sockets filled according to color, with these gems (as Rawr works right now).
3) Add gemmed items I'm wearing right now.


Value of Stats
============
Show what one value of stamina, agility, AP, armor penetration, etc is worth to me.


Strange start
===========
When I started Rawr b13.1 I had copied my character xml-files from b12.1
When I started up Rawr the list view (right pane) was just a big red cross. No matter what I selected, it didn't work.
In the end I used Tools->Update Item Cache, and then restarted Rawr. After that everything seemed to work.
Bug?

Those are my initial thoughts!
Keep up the good work!

You're looking for very specific item vs item comparisons, which is not what the Optimizer is for. For very specific [this item with this enchant with these gems] vs [that item with that enchant with those gems], just try it and see. The Optimizer is for finding the Optimal set of gear, given what's available to you.



Where items come from
=====================
It would be nice to be able to use that information. For example, find upgrades for me from SSC (regardless of slot). Or find upgrades for me from everything except for BT/MH/Sunwell (one slot at a time, as Rawr normally works).

We're working on adding some sort of filtering by source location, but the data just isn't there to support it yet. We're hopeful for something like this in a future version, but it depends on getting better data from the Armory, or WowDBhead exposing their data.

==========

Then be able to fill (and make copies as follows) (selection which to fill this time):
1) All sockets filled with this gem: select one gem and a meta gem.
2) Sockets filled according to color, with these gems (as Rawr works right now).
3) Add gemmed items I'm wearing right now.

There are alot of ideas on how to better handle gems, for sure. The current way is very verbose, cluttered. However making many changes to the gem system has a ton of implications to it, and we could easily make it worse. So we won't be changing much with gemmings until we've got a really solid solution that everyone understands and finds easy. That said, a sort of mass delete and recreate specific gemmings wouldn't be out of the question, and could actually be quite viable... I'll see what I can do for next release.

Hopefully we can find a better long term solution, but you can do what you want to do right now. Basically, you want to make a copy of the shoulders with the enchant and the gems built in to the item stats, then select no available shoulder enchants.

1. Select edit on the item you want to make set version for (Mantle of Malorne)
2. Press Duplicate.
3. Change the name to Mantle of Malorne - Tank
4. Change each socket to None and the socket bonus to None.
5. For each gem, add it to the stats. Lets say you have 2 solid stars and a 10 dodge/15 def enchant. Add 24 stamina (49 total), 10 dodge, 15 defense and 3 crit (for the socket bonus).
6. Make sure you leave the gem fields blank.
7. Set the item id to something between 90000-100000 (so update wont revert your changes).

Do the same thing for your kitty setup shoulders. Make sure you have no enchants enabled for the optimizer.

This should do what you are trying to do. Hopefully we can come up with a better long term solution, but this should help in the short term.

How does Rawr determine when a set bonus is active? If I take some Malorne items, duplicate them and change their id - will Rawr still understand that the item contributes to the set bonus? It seems that way, but I want to be sure how I can change an item and still have the optimizer understand it.

Yeah, there are a few properties of items that aren't visible on the editor, including what Set an item belongs to. Those are preserved when an item is duplicated though, so yeah, just be sure to duplicate, not create a new item.
